1.21.19  3:41 pm   how do you feel when people overanalyze everything you do in your songs and your reality videos?

     i'm not always notified

1.21.19  3:29 pm   Would you consider your style to be a sub-genre of or a derivative of jazz?

     no

1.21.19  2:49 pm   What does it mean in the airport terminal song, "and i think im dying but im just being born? i am confusion.

     to each person it may mean a different thing. for me it meant yep that's the line that goes there, for sure. looks right, feels right, sounds right. taking a closer look i guess the line is a sort of good news scenario because if you're dying that means your whole life is behind you, where as if you are just being born that means your whole life is ahead of you. could be a nice surprise

1.21.19  2:42 pm   What's your favourite thing to do in your free time?

     attempt to raise the value of the time

1.21.19  2:25 pm   What is your definition of "creativity"

     changing the definition

1.21.19  2:17 pm   hey man.  sometimes i struggle to be optimistic about what i'm doing, but then i look to your videos and i become positive that it will all work out in the end. was there ever a time back then when you weren't optimistic about your own stuff

     i don't think so

      and how did you overcome that

1.21.19  2:05 pm   how much time is there?

     1

1.21.19  1:38 pm   Given the immense distance between our two locations (European here) , do you think I'll ever get the chance to meet you and take a picture?

     i think it's pretty strange to take a picture of someone when you meet them for the first time, and it can give the relationship a pretty strange dynamic from that point forward

     I guess what I'm asking is do you see yourself coming to Eutope in a professional capacity in the near future? Or if that's hard to predict, would you even want to come to Europe in the near future? If you decide that's a reasonable thing to do I hope you post where you'll be and when so I can come

     about half way

     seems legit

     i'm not sure

1.21.19  4:01 am   I want to accomplish something that is seemingly impossible, how do I get people to take me seriously when I tell them my goal

     forget that, i don't know why you would tell them. that's gallons of senseless awkwardness / humiliation you could do without, and then later let them find out about it after you have succeeded, and then they will be very surprised and impressed, considering how impossible what you've done seems. reference

     there is no time to spare

1.21.19  1:55 am   how many easter eggs are on your site

     zero but there is an easter bunny

1.21.19  1:47 am   hey bill, it's the dom9no3 chord guy whose question you didn't follow when I initially asked it. This is what I was getting at (more fleshed out). The dom9 chord (e.g. G9: G-B-D-F-A) is probably the most consonant

     consonant? not sure what that means here

      combination of 5 notes that we have in the 12-note scale. In lots of compositions, chords are more frequently thought of in 4 voices instead of 5 (thank u bach chorales), so we frequently encounter chords that are 4 out of the 5 notes of a dominant 9 chord. Using the G chord, we have G7 = G9 no9, Gadd9 = G9 no7, Dm6 = B hdim7 = G9 no1, and I sometimes also see G9 approximated in 4 voices by leaving out the 5th. These four are all pretty common chords, all quite consonant. But the 5th 4-pitch chord coming from the dom9 that should be just as consonant as the other 4 is G9 no3 = {D,F,G,A} = d minor add4.

     i'd call it Dmin over G, which is rampantly common, especially in the 1970s 'funk' sort of things. it can be used in the place of G9 or Gmin9. you wouldn't have to specify. james brown songs use these all day. i use them all the time

      The frequency I see minor add4 chords in leadsheets and such is basically zero compared to the other 4 chords that are dom9 chords omitting 1 of the 5 notes.

     if you put the bass on G, which i think is where it's supposed to be according to your study, i think you will find it much more commonly. or actually perhaps the lead sheet will just say G9 or Gmin9 but in reality the execution will leave out the 3rd

      Do you feel there is a good reason for this?

     this study is not really taking account for where the bass is

      Is the the minor add4 chord lacking something musically that makes it rare compared to the other chords mentioned, even though it should ""theoretically"" sound just as reasonable? 

     i'm not following why it 'should theoretically' sound just as reasonable, but if you feel it has been under-used, you now have an opportunity to find and demonstrate its goodness. if you find that it really is not so good, then it is only you who can explain why you don't like it

1.21.19  12:33 am   how much thought went into transcribing the lyrics to the "ngiueh" song?

     1

      did you have alternate draft spellings such as "nyeuh" or "gneiugh?"

     no

      or did you come up with the spelling "ngiueh" first and then have to figure out how you were gonna pronounce it?

     the audio was first

1.20.19  11:27 pm   i'm 19 and am slightly good at singing. is it too late to get Really good?

     no

      also, do u have suggestions as to how to work around the extreme fear of being heard since i have no private space to just go and Get Good

     read about some things that are more scary, and then your fears might seem less extreme by comparison

1.20.19  10:57 pm   How many times on average do you go through revisions before you get lyrics where you want them?

     i do the music and lyrics together, but maybe 50, or 2 depending on how you are calculating

1.20.19  9:27 pm   what do you do during a mental block? 

     i don't know

1.20.19  8:17 pm   honest question, why all the ambiguity?

     why all the honesty

      I apreciate your cheeky answers to more ludicrous or unanswerable questions but when it's a straight question why not give an honest answer?

     to change it up, to make up for all the other honest answers

      I mean, at the end of yhe day you choose what to answer so why not skip the questions that you can't fully/honestly/accurately answer? 

     honesty and accuracy are awesome, and those are but just 2 of the many ingredients i use to give this page the over all experience i aim for it to have

     only 4 but it doesn't matter, you can draw the bar lines anywhere and still have it sound like they are somewhere else

     you

1.20.19  5:14 pm   Are airport terminals some kind of purgatory?

     yes but they are a very friendly kind

1.20.19  5:10 pm   OK bill, I need you to please please please help me out on this one:

I have watched your interview with H3H3 I don't know how many times (too many), 'cause say what you want, but I think it's reeeally good. The part that I can't stop going back to over and over is when you talk about schedules, which are absolutely crucial for *getting things done*. Without them I've also noticed that there are just so many options, and you end up being all over the place, and one thing can go on forever.

Now, I'm pretty darn good at planning and making schedules, but where I mess up is in the execution. I can't stick to my plans mainly because I get distracted. As soon as whatever was planned on the schedule starts getting a bit difficult, or uncomfortable, I stop doing it and switch to a non-planned activity such as reading the news on twitter, or some other lame thing like that.

Now don't get me wrong, I really want to do the thing s that I 've planned and are on the schedule, I like those things and I feel enthusiastic about it, it's just that whenever it gets hard, I'm too weak.

What's the secret to stick to the schedule no. matter. what.?

I don't want to get old and be like: "arghasdh... I was meant to do all those good things, but I was way too weak to end them D: ...I hate myself! "

     first you must complete the 12 levels of suffering, then the 13th which is the unlucky last and final level; the reason it is unlucky is because after you finish it you will be informed that there is another level after that

1.20.19  4:17 pm   in your live show, which you are planning to plan, will you improvise your vocal melodies so that you don't get tired of them after many performances?

     somewhat

1.20.19  4:04 pm   do you believe in the existence of the self?

     sure

      if so, what would you say the self actually is

     you, and me

1.20.19  3:34 pm   what is the importance of transcribing?

     it will help you learn what things are, and also learn to read

      what i do right now is i use a sequencer to recreate everything i can hear in a song i like (drums bass chords etc.) but i'm just using my ears.

     that will help you learn what things are

      also what do i transcribe?

     anything you want

      something like a lead sheet with just melody and chords or do i do everyhing

     try them all individually, or together, or different combinations

(western music, eastern music, ancient music like sumerian, mesopotamian etc.) music seems like a beast that's too wild to tame.

     that's true

1.20.19  12:59 pm   in the song long long long journey what is that called when it does the thing 'Its been a long long day' then it shifts down 'and we've come a long long way' what is it doing

     i don't know but i could show you how to do it. the magic note you'll need is the #5 note, so if you are in the key of C, the magic note you'll need is G#. but the song is actually in the key of F# so the magic note in that case would be D. you'll want the Ab note at the same time
